Key Match Events: India took a major step at sealing a spot for themselves in the semi-finals of the 2022 T20 World Cup by beating the Netherlands by 56 runs on Thursday at the Sydney Cricket Ground.
Virat Kohli scored a second consecutive half century, along with fifties from Suryakumar Yadav and Rohit Sharma.
India restricted Netherlands to a score of 123/9 after they had scored 179/2.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India played an unchanged squad to the one that beat Pakistan in dramatic fashion on Sunday in what was their first match of the tournament.

Spinner Yuzvendra Chahal remained on the sidelines, with India choosing to go with Ravichandran Ashwin and Axar Patel as their spinning options on the predominantly pacer friendly conditions in Australia.
